snippet: Analysts say China has fixed upon a strategy to take back the islands known as Diaoyu in China and the Senkaku in Japan,  by using air and naval patrols as evidence that they are in charge.
abstract: Sortie by Chinese aircraft swooping low over waters close to disputed islands in East China Sea is latest move by China to increase pressure on Japan over who owns uninhabited island chain; analysts say China is using steady escalation in air, on sea and in public statements designed to take back islands.
lead_paragraph: Analysts say China has fixed upon a strategy to take back the islands known as Diaoyu in China and the Senkaku in Japan,  by using air and naval patrols as evidence that they are in charge.

headline.seo: China Steps Up Pressure On Japan in Island Dispute
headline.main: China Steps Up Pressure on Japan in Island Dispute
headline.print_headline: China Steps Up Pressure On Japan in Island Dispute
